name: Coreos
tagline: How to setup a CoreOS cluster along with some useful bells and whistles
body:
## Summary
* Setup 3 node CoreOS cluster via Cloud Formation fronted by an ELB
* Deploy monitoring and logging containers
* Deploy http server container
* Setup .bit domain
* Add CI/CD

## 1) Setup Docker
install virtualbox (needed by boot2docker):
https://www.virtualbox.org/

install vagrant (not strictly necessary but comes in handy if you want to create local clusters vs EC2):
https://www.vagrantup.com/downloads

install docker locally (assuming you are on a mac here so youâ€™ll need use boot2docker):
https://docs.docker.com/installation/mac/

create an account on dockerhub:
https://hub.docker.com/

## 2) Setup AWS
Docs:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/cli-chap-getting-set-up.html

Get an account with Amazon AWS.  You will have to pay for your usage.  A single CoreOS cluster with an ELB is costing me about $3 a day.
Register here: https://aws.amazon.com/
Add an account via IAM
Generate an SSH keypair and upload the public key

Install the AWS command line tools:
```
wget https://s3.amazonaws.com/aws-cli/awscli-bundle.zip
unzip awscli-bundle.zip
sudo ./awscli-bundle/install -i /usr/local/aws -b /usr/local/bin/aws
```

Add necessary environment variables to your ~/.bash_profile:
```
# AWS creds
export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=XXXXXXXXXXXXXX
export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
export AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=us-west-1
export AWS_DEFAULT_OUTPUT=text
```
